dawncraft.title: DawnCraft
dawncraft.quests1.title: DawnCraft
dawncraft.quests1.subtitle:
Welcome to DawnCraft.

This modpack uses its custom quest system instead of the traditional FTBQuest system.

This book gives you some basic information you might want to know about the adventure ahead.
dawncraft.quests1.tasks.title: Don't Die!

useful_commands_for_servers.title: Useful Info
useful_commands_for_servers.quests1.subt: How to disable friendly fire on servers?
useful_commands_for_servers.quests2.subt: How to recover death inventory in case of a rare bug where corpse disappear for no reason.
useful_commands_for_servers.quests3.subt: A list of keybinds you should know!
useful_commands_for_servers.quests3.desc: Press "i" for your last death info
Press "b" to open your backpack \n                 (if equipped)
Press "n" to open your quiver\n                 (if equipped)
Press "k" to check and\n            select enabled skills
useful_commands_for_servers.quests4.subt: A list of info books you might want. Check in the inventory search bar for their individual crafting recipe!
useful_commands_for_servers.quests5.subt: Where can you find a guild master?
useful_commands_for_servers.quests5.desc: GuildMaster is not a separate entity to villager. Instead, it is a profession, attainable by any villager (except nitwit). \n

The profession block (POI) is the bell commonly found in guild house or stalls. If you find a village with a stall without a guild master, try to wait till noon for villagers to start getting jobs. \n
You could also try to "guide" villagers to the bell, with whatever means possible within the realms of Minecraft.
useful_commands_for_servers.quests6.subt: Why won't villagers interact with me?
useful_commands_for_servers.quests6.desc: The information is available in wiki. But one common mistake is that players loot containers that they did not place in front of villagers. This does not only apply to chests within villages. If there is a villager seeing you commit a 'crime' anywhere in the world, your reputation will decrease. \n\nThe maximum amount of bundled currency you'll need to improve your reputation is 8. But that's very unlikely to happen, unless you were to massacre villages. Most of the time 1-2 bundled currencies will be enough.
\nHowever, if you feel that your low reputation is misjudged and would like to start out at 0 rep, turn on cheats and do \n/setreputation reputation:villager @p 0
\nNote that you will ALSO need a trading scroll on TOP of having enough reputation to trade with a villager. A trading scroll can be obtained via completing villager quests.
useful_commands_for_servers.quests7.subt: How to get better trade prices?
useful_commands_for_servers.quests7.desc: Trade prices are absurdly high if you have neutral reputation with the villagers.\n
However, finishing just 1-2 side quests alone will most likely significantly reduce the price of trades.
useful_commands_for_servers.quests8.subt: How are main quests' completion detected?
useful_commands_for_servers.quests8.desc: Besides killing pillagers and Goblin King, all the other main quests are detected through the player picking up the ender eyes.

\nSo if you have killed one of the bosses (Eye Holders) beforehand and obtained the eye. All you have to do is drop the eye the Eye Holder held, then pick it up again. With that you should be able to complete the guildmaster's quest.
useful_commands_for_servers.quests9.desc: Recommended for Best Visuals:\n        - Complimentary Reimagined
\n         Try others if these don't \n           fit your preferences!
useful_commands_for_servers.quests10.sub: How do I protect my properties in a server?
useful_commands_for_servers.quests10.des: Look into the mod 'Claim Chunks'. This mod adds a new block - Claim Block into the game. \n\nCheck their CurseForge page to learn how to customize your chunk permissions!
\n*The max amount of chunks a player could claim is 8 by default.
useful_commands_for_servers.quests11.sub: How to enable vanilla graphics settings menu?
useful_commands_for_servers.quests12.des: The mod is used in a different way\n    in this pack. Forget that it exists.
useful_commands_for_servers.quests13.sub: How do I read an explorer map?
useful_commands_for_servers.quests13.des: Notice the little dot around the edge of the map. That's you. The TOP of the map points to north; The LEFT of the map points to east; etc...
\nThere is sometimes a bug in Vanilla Minecraft where a cross is not shown in the map. In cases like this, you will need to look around the area that the map is located in.
